blocks.name: ontopbas
blocks.content: An ordinal number is a topological basis. (Contributed by Chen-Pang He, 8-Oct-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm ontopbas(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, con0), wcel(c0, ctb))
} = {
  mpdan(wcel(c0, con0), wcel(c0, ctb), wral(hs0, c0, wral(hs1, c0, wcel(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), c0))))
  ralrimivv(hs0, hs1, c0, c0, wcel(c0, con0), wcel(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), c0))
  syl6c(wcel(c0, con0), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs1), c0)), wcel(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), c0), wa(wcel(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), con0), wcel(c0, con0)), wa(wss(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs0), c0)))
  anc2ri(wcel(c0, con0), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs1), c0)), wcel(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), con0))
  syl6(wcel(c0, con0), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs1), c0)), wcel(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), con0), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), con0), wcel(cv(hs1), con0)))
  ex(wcel(c0, con0), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs1), c0)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), con0), wcel(cv(hs1), con0)))
  anim12dan(wcel(c0, con0), wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs1), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), con0), wcel(cv(hs1), con0))
  onelon(c0, cv(hs0))
  onelon(c0, cv(hs1))
  onin(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))
  a1i(wcel(c0, con0), wi(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs1), c0)), wa(wss(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs0), c0))))
  adantr(wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs1), c0), wa(wss(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs0), c0)))
  jctl(wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wss(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), cv(hs0)))
  inss1(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))
  ontr2(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), c0, cv(hs0))
  fiinbas(hs0, hs1, c0, con0)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(c0, con0))
  diff.hs1.w(wcel(c0, con0))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(con0)
  diff.hs1.c(con0)
}

  ex(c0 ‚àà On, (hs0 ‚àà c0 ‚àß hs1 ‚àà c0), (hs0 ‚àà On ‚àß hs1 ‚àà On))
  anim12dan(c0 ‚àà On, hs0 ‚àà c0, hs1 ‚àà c0, hs0 ‚àà On, hs1 ‚àà On)
  onelon(c0, hs0)

  adantr(hs0 ‚àà c0, hs1 ‚àà c0, ((hs0 ‚ãÇ hs1)‚äÜ hs0 ‚àß hs0 ‚àà c0))

}

blocks.name: onsstopbas
blocks.content: The class of ordinal numbers is a subclass of the class of topological bases. (Contributed by Chen-Pang He, 8-Oct-2015.)

blocks.name: onpsstopbas
blocks.content: The class of ordinal numbers is a proper subclass of the class of topological bases. (Contributed by Chen-Pang He, 9-Oct-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm onpsstopbas() {
  |- wpss(con0, ctb)
} = {
  mp2(wpss(con0, ctb), wss(con0, ctb), wa(wcel(cpr(emptycls, csn(csn(emptycls))), ctb), wn(wcel(cpr(emptycls, csn(csn(emptycls))), con0))))
  onsstopbas()
  pm3.2i(wcel(cpr(emptycls, csn(csn(emptycls))), ctb), wn(wcel(cpr(emptycls, csn(csn(emptycls))), con0)))
  ax-mp(wcel(cpr(emptycls, csn(csn(emptycls))), ctb), wcel(cpr(emptycls, csn(csn(emptycls))), ctop))
  indistop(csn(csn(emptycls)))
  topbas(cpr(emptycls, csn(csn(emptycls))))
  mto(wcel(cpr(emptycls, csn(csn(emptycls))), con0), wi(wcel(csn(csn(emptycls)), cpr(emptycls, csn(csn(emptycls)))), wcel(csn(csn(emptycls)), con0)))
  mp2(wn(wi(wcel(csn(csn(emptycls)), cpr(emptycls, csn(csn(emptycls)))), wcel(csn(csn(emptycls)), con0))), wcel(csn(csn(emptycls)), cpr(emptycls, csn(csn(emptycls)))), wn(wcel(csn(csn(emptycls)), con0)))
  prid2(csn(csn(emptycls)), emptycls)
  snex(csn(emptycls))
  snsn0non()
  mth8(wcel(csn(csn(emptycls)), cpr(emptycls, csn(csn(emptycls)))), wcel(csn(csn(emptycls)), con0))
  ex(wcel(cpr(emptycls, csn(csn(emptycls))), con0), wcel(csn(csn(emptycls)), cpr(emptycls, csn(csn(emptycls)))), wcel(csn(csn(emptycls)), con0))
  onelon(cpr(emptycls, csn(csn(emptycls))), csn(csn(emptycls)))
  ssnelpss(con0, ctb, cpr(emptycls, csn(csn(emptycls))))
}

blocks.name: ontgval
blocks.content: The topology generated from an ordinal number ` B ` is ` suc U. B ` . (Contributed by Chen-Pang He, 10-Oct-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm ontgval(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, con0), wceq(cfv(ctg, c0), csuc(cuni(c0))))
} = {
  eqrdv(hs0, cfv(ctg, c0), csuc(cuni(c0)), wcel(c0, con0))
  impbid(wcel(c0, con0), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(ctg, c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), csuc(cuni(c0))))
  syl6c(wcel(c0, con0), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(ctg, c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), csuc(cuni(c0))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), con0), wcel(csuc(cuni(c0)), con0)), wa(wss(cv(hs0), cuni(c0)), wcel(cuni(c0), csuc(cuni(c0)))))
  jctird(wcel(c0, con0), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(ctg, c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), con0), wcel(csuc(cuni(c0)), con0))
  syl2imc(wcel(c0, con0), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(ctg, c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), con0), wceq(cv(hs0), cuni(cin(c0, cpw(cv(hs0))))), wcel(cuni(cin(c0, cpw(cv(hs0)))), con0))
  eltg4i(cv(hs0), c0)
  sylc(wcel(c0, con0), wcel(cuni(cin(c0, cpw(cv(hs0)))), con0), wcel(cin(c0, cpw(cv(hs0))), universe), wss(cin(c0, cpw(cv(hs0))), con0))
  inex1g(c0, con0, cpw(cv(hs0)))
  syl(wcel(c0, con0), wss(cin(c0, cpw(cv(hs0))), con0), wss(c0, con0))
  onss(c0)
  ssinss1(c0, con0, cpw(cv(hs0)))
  ssonuni(cin(c0, cpw(cv(hs0))), universe)
  biimprd(wceq(cv(hs0), cuni(cin(c0, cpw(cv(hs0))))), wcel(cuni(cin(c0, cpw(cv(hs0)))), con0), wcel(cv(hs0), con0))
  eleq1(cv(hs0), cuni(cin(c0, cpw(cv(hs0)))), con0)
  syl(wcel(c0, con0), wcel(csuc(cuni(c0)), con0), wcel(cuni(c0), con0))
  suceloni(cuni(c0))
  jctird(wcel(c0, con0), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(ctg, c0)), wss(cv(hs0), cuni(c0)), wcel(cuni(c0), csuc(cuni(c0))))
  a1i(wcel(c0, con0), wi(wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(ctg, c0)), wss(cv(hs0), cuni(c0))))
  tg1(cv(hs0), c0)
  syl(wcel(c0, con0), wcel(cuni(c0), csuc(cuni(c0))), wcel(cuni(c0), con0))
  onuni(c0)
  sucidg(cuni(c0), con0)
  ontr2(cv(hs0), csuc(cuni(c0)), cuni(c0))
  syl5(wcel(c0, con0), wcel(cv(hs0), csuc(cuni(c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(ctg, c0)), wo(wcel(cv(hs0), cuni(c0)), wceq(cv(hs0), cuni(c0))))
  elsuci(cv(hs0), cuni(c0))
  jaod(wcel(c0, con0), wcel(cv(hs0), cuni(c0)), wceq(cv(hs0), cuni(c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(ctg, c0)))
  sseld(cv(hs0), cuni(c0), cfv(ctg, c0), wcel(c0, con0))
  sstrd(cuni(c0), cfv(ctg, c0), c0, wcel(c0, con0))
  syl(wcel(c0, con0), wss(cuni(c0), c0), word(c0))
  eloni(c0)
  orduniss(c0)
  bastg(c0, con0)
  syl(wcel(c0, con0), wi(wceq(cv(hs0), cuni(c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(ctg, c0))), wcel(cuni(c0), cfv(ctg, c0)))
  mpan2(wcel(c0, con0), wcel(cuni(c0), cfv(ctg, c0)), wss(c0, c0))
  ssid(c0)
  eltg3i(c0, con0, c0)
  eleq1a(cuni(c0), cfv(ctg, c0), cv(hs0))

  diff.hs0.c(csuc(cuni(c0)))
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(c0, con0))

  elsuci(hs0, ‚ãÉ c0)
  jaod(c0 ‚àà On, hs0 ‚àà ‚ãÉ c0, hs0 = ‚ãÉ c0, hs0 ‚àà(topGen ` c0))
  sseld(hs0, ‚ãÉ c0, (topGen ` c0), c0 ‚àà On)
  sstrd(‚ãÉ c0, (topGen ` c0), c0, c0 ‚àà On)

blocks.name: ontgsucval
blocks.content: The topology generated from a successor ordinal number is itself. (Contributed by Chen-Pang He, 11-Oct-2015.)

blocks.name: onsuctop
blocks.content: A successor ordinal number is a topology. (Contributed by Chen-Pang He, 11-Oct-2015.)

blocks.name: onsuctopon
blocks.content: One of the topologies on an ordinal number is its successor. (Contributed by Chen-Pang He, 7-Nov-2015.)

blocks.name: ordtoplem
blocks.content: Membership of the class of successor ordinals. (Contributed by Chen-Pang He, 1-Nov-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm ordtoplem(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(word(c0), wi(wne(c0, cuni(c0)), wcel(c0, c1)))
  -| wi(wcel(cuni(c0), con0), wcel(csuc(cuni(c0)), c1))
} = {
  syl5bi(word(c0), wne(c0, cuni(c0)), wcel(c0, c1), wn(wceq(c0, cuni(c0))))
  df-ne(c0, cuni(c0))
  syl6c(word(c0), wn(wceq(c0, cuni(c0))), wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c0, con0), wceq(c0, csuc(cuni(c0))))
  ord(word(c0), wceq(c0, cuni(c0)), wcel(c0, con0))
  orcomd(word(c0), wceq(c0, cuni(c0)), wcel(c0, con0))
  sylbi(word(c0), wo(wcel(c0, con0), wceq(c0, cuni(c0))), wo(wcel(c0, con0), wceq(c0, con0)))
  ordeleqon(c0)
  orim2i(wcel(c0, con0), wceq(c0, con0), wceq(c0, cuni(c0)))
  3eqtr4a(c0, cuni(c0), con0, cuni(con0), wceq(c0, con0))
  eqcomi(con0, cuni(con0))
  unon()
  id(wceq(c0, con0))
  unieq(c0, con0)
  ord(word(c0), wceq(c0, cuni(c0)), wceq(c0, csuc(cuni(c0))))
  orduniorsuc(c0)
  3syl(wcel(c0, con0), wi(wceq(c0, csuc(cuni(c0))), wcel(c0, c1)), wcel(cuni(c0), con0), wcel(csuc(cuni(c0)), c1))
  onuni(c0)
  eleq1a(csuc(cuni(c0)), c1, c0)
}

blocks.name: ordtop
blocks.content: An ordinal is a topology iff it is not its supremum (union), proven without the Axiom of Regularity. (Contributed by Chen-Pang He, 1-Nov-2015.)

blocks.name: onsucconni
blocks.content: A successor ordinal number is a connected topology. (Contributed by Chen-Pang He, 16-Oct-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm onsucconni(class c0) {
  |- wcel(csuc(c0), cconn)
  -| wcel(c0, con0)
} = {
  mpbir2an(wcel(csuc(c0), cconn), wcel(csuc(c0), ctop), wss(cin(csuc(c0), cfv(ccld, csuc(c0))), cpr(emptycls, c0)))
  ax-mp(wcel(csuc(c0), ctop), wcel(c0, con0))
  onsuctop(c0)
  ssriv(hs0, cin(csuc(c0), cfv(ccld, csuc(c0))), cpr(emptycls, c0))
  sylbi(wcel(cv(hs0), cin(csuc(c0), cfv(ccld, csuc(c0)))), wcel(cv(hs0), cpr(emptycls, c0)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), csuc(c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(ccld, csuc(c0)))))

blocks.name: limsucncmp
blocks.content: The successor of a limit ordinal is not compact. (Contributed by Chen-Pang He, 20-Oct-2015.)

blocks.name: ordcmp
blocks.content: An ordinal topology is compact iff the underlying set is its supremum (union) only when the ordinal is ` 1o ` . (Contributed by Chen-Pang He, 1-Nov-2015.)

blocks.name: oninhaus
blocks.content: The ordinal Hausdorff spaces are ` 1o ` and ` 2o ` . (Contributed by Chen-Pang He, 10-Nov-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm oninhaus() {
  |- wceq(cin(con0, cha), cpr(c1o, c2o))
} = {
  eqssi(cin(con0, cha), cpr(c1o, c2o))
  sseqtri(cin(con0, cha), cpr(c1o, c2o), cin(con0, ct1))
  ax-mp(wss(cin(con0, cha), cin(con0, ct1)), wss(cha, ct1))
  ssriv(hs0, cha, ct1)
  haust1(cv(hs0))
  sslin(cha, ct1, con0)
  onint1()
  ssoninhaus()
  diff.hs0.c(cha)
  diff.hs0.c(ct1)
}
